title: Mexico - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, a man on a motorcycle was shot and killed by armed men in a car in a drive-by in Colonia Lomas de San Mateo. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2021, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents of the Colonias Obrera and PRD blocked the Vicente Guerrero Boulevard to protest and demand a supply of piped water as well as garbage collection service. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in San Jose Xicohtencatl, Tlaxcala, a man was tied to a pole and beaten up by people after he and his two accomplices stole from a business. The man was caught up by the residents and tied up. Later he was taken by his family. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in El Limon de los Ramos, Sinaloa, two men were shot and killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture, hands, feet and face covered with tape. According to the police, the victims were kidnapped that day and were killed when they tried to escape. 2 fatalities.

On 5 February 2021, in Palo Blanco, Guerrero, alleged students of the Normal school of Ayotzinapa took over the toll booth to ask drivers for financial contribution. The event is part of a protest to pay for the institution's expenses as protesters argued that the school is lacking resources due to the governmental budget cuts. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Paso Morelos, Guerrero, alleged students of the Normal school of Ayotzinapa took over the toll booth to ask drivers for financial contribution. The event is part of a protest to pay for the institution's expenses as protesters argued that the school is lacking resources due to the governmental budget cuts. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in El Treinta, Guerrero, alleged students of the Normal school of Ayotzinapa took over the toll booth to ask money from drivers as part of a protest and to pay for the institution's expenses. Protesters argued that due to the government's budget cuts, they do not have enough resources. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, around 30 students of the General Felipe Angeles student hostel held a protest in front of the Municipal palace facilities to demand financial support. Their livelihoods have been affected by coronavirus measures. [size=around 30]
Military Forces of Mexico (2018-); Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police

On 5 February 2021, in Madero municipality, Michoacan (coded to Villa Madero), the municipal police together with the military, National Guard and the ministerial police found and destroyed a narco-camp in Moreno community.

On 5 February 2021, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands and feet tied and his genitals mutilated inside a Motel room. According to the security video of the motel, the victim entered the motel with two women previously, who according to the authorities could be the perpetrators. The victim was a high state official. 1 fatality.
On 5 February 2021, in Paraiso, Tabasco, 82 construction workers started a sit-in demanding better wages and the payment of overtime as established by the Federal Labor Law. [size=82]

On 5 February 2021, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, a group of at least 20 militants and supporters of Morena in San Luis Potosi symbolically took over the facilities of the State Committee of the Morena party against the nomination of a candidate for the state governorship on behalf of the party. [size=at least 20]

On 5 February 2021, in Merida, Yucatan, horticulturists from Ixil protested outside the Government Palace to demand facilities to transport their products as coronavirus sanitary measures restricting the movement of people have been impacting their professional activities. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Hermosillo, Sonora, about 30 widows and relatives of policemen who died while on-duty in Cananea, Navojoa, Hermosillo and other municipalities protested in front of the Government Palace to demand the payment of pensions and insurance that have been owed to them for five years. [size=about 30]
Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), in Caborca, Sonora, a man was killed and his body was found with a narco-message by the side. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the Indigenous Artisan Movement Originating blocked the Eje Central Lazaro Cardenas avenue and Juarez avenue to demand justice for the indigenous community of Oaxaca. The protesters requested the intervention of federal authorities and the National Guard amid attacks perpetrated by paramilitaries affiliated the Triqui Struggle Unifying Movement (MULT). [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Hermosillo, Sonora, a man was shot and injured by several armed men in front of his house in Colonia Fonhapo.

On 5 February 2021, in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, at least 40 residents blocked the old Mexico-Pachuca highway in Santa Maria Chiconautla neighborhood to protest and demand renovation work in their community as agreed on 11 September 2020 . [size=at least 40]
Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police

On 5 February 2021, in Ensenada, Baja California, police elements of the State Attorney General's Office (FGE) carried out a strike to demand the payment of their benefits and improvements to their working conditions. The police officers gathered in front of the offices in El Cipres. This event was part of a state-wide strike. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, about 50 health workers of the SIENA private hospital staff in Colonia Jardines del Moral protested against poor working conditions and demanded protective equipment to treat patients with coronavirus. [size=about 50]

On 5 February 2021, in Celaya, Guanajuato, a man was shot and killed and another man was shot and injured. The injured man is the owner of a junkyard. According to one version, two armed men on a motorcycle shot at the owner and his employee. According to another version, two armed men tried to rob the owner who defended himself. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2021, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a man was shot and killed in Colonia Loma Bonita by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by). In another event, a man was shot and killed and another man was shot and injured and left with a cardboard message. They were both found on Las Judas-Barretos highway. 2 fatalities.

On 5 February 2021, in Veracruz, Veracruz, relatives of self-defense groups in Veracruz began a hunger strike outside the Comprehensive Center of Justice to demand that they be shown the videos of the detention of their relatives. They claim that their relatives were unfairly prosecuted, denounced irregularities in the investigation and stated they have received threats. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Sayula de Aleman, Veracruz, a group of owners and employees of dining rooms protested to demand an end to abuses perpetrated by the Civil Force. The protesters explained that the day before, police elements broke into their establishments and stole household goods, belongings and even food. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, 50 restaurant owners, waiters, cooks and employees of different restaurants Colonia Roma Norte held a pot-banging protest along Cuauhtemoc Avenue to demand the extension of opening hours to operate during the weekend despite coronavirus sanitary measures. [size=50]

On 5 February 2021, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, beneficiaries of the clinic of the Institute of Social Security and Services for State Workers (ISSSTE) closed the road of Orizaba Avenue to demand better medical attention. They argued that there is a lack of medicines and personnel. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, around Las Choapas, Veracruz, workers of the Autonomous Confederation of Workers and Employees of Mexico (CATEM) of Las Choapas attacked with gunshots and machetes the workers of the same institution in Agua Dulce. The conflict was created as workers of Agua Dulce allegedly hired people from their own community to carry out road works, rather than hiring through workers' unions. No injuries nor fatalities reported. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of feminist groups protested outside the representation of the state of Chiapas to demand an halt to femicides. [size=no report]
On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, two men were shot and killed while driving by two armed men on a motorcycle in a drive-by in Colonia Nuevo Amanecer. 2 fatalities.

On 5 February 2021, in Tapachula de Cordova y Ordonez, Chiapas, around 200 medical school students protested and demanded justice for the killing of their colleague on 28 January in Ocosingo. [size=around 200]
Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; La Jornada; El Norte

On 5 February 2021, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, hundreds of medical school students of different educational institutions protested and marched demanding better conditions to perform their work. They also demanded justice for the killing of their colleague on 28 January in Ocosingo. [size=hundreds]
Sintesis; MiMorelia; El Siglo de Durango

On 5 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, cyclists staged a protest around Colonia Napoles to demand justice for the killing of some of their colleagues by motorists. The transit police intervened and beat up the protesters. Several protesters were injured. [size=no report]

Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in plastic bags and covered with a tarp in Calzada Lomas del Molino in Colonia Bosque Azul. 1 fatality.

On 5 February 2021, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, for the third day in a row, merchants of the Amalucan market protested in front of the Municipal Palace against demolition works in the market. Protesters claimed the demolition will impact their professional activities, already affected by coronavirus sanitary measures. [size=no report]

Around 5 February 2021 (as reported), in Miguel Aleman municipality, Tamaulipas (coded to Ciudad Miguel Aleman), four people were killed and their bodies were found burned in El Barretal ranch. According to preliminary investigations, the event could related to a clash between criminal groups. 4 fatalities.

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Guerrero with 5 reports followed by Distrito Federal with 4 reports.
The largest admin2 is Chilpancingo de los Bravo with 3 reports followed by Cuauhtemoc with 3 reports.
The largest admin1 is Distrito Federal with 3795 reports followed by Guanajuato with 3184 reports.
The largest admin2 is Cuauhtemoc with 1611 reports followed by Tijuana with 1344 reports.
The largest admin1 is Distrito Federal with 3795 reports followed by Guanajuato with 3184 reports.
